statement:
If $f$ is a ring homomorphism from a subring $\mathfrak{o}$ of a field
$k$ to an algebraically closed field $F$ such that $f(1) = 1$, then
there exists a $$\varphi: \,k\to F\cup\{\infty\}$$ of the field $k$ such
that $$\varphi|_\mathfrak{o} = f.$$

**Note.** That $F$ should be algebraically closed, does not , since
every field is extendable to such one.

[8]{} Emil Artin: [**]{}. Lecture notes. Mathematisches Institut,
Göttingen (1959).
